Original:
When we talk about strengthening bones then we can’t forget two essential nutrients – vitamin D and Calcium. As vitamins helps in calcium absorption for growth of bones and calcium supports our teeth and bones structure.Of course, these two nutrients are very important in the growing ages but we cannot forget them with increasing age. They prevent diseases such as osteoporosis and reduce the risk of bone fracture in older age.
It has been suggested that person below the age of 50 years should include 1,000 mg of calcium along with 200 IUs of vitamin D, on daily basis. However, person above the age of 50 years should include 1,200 mg of calcium along with vitamin D in an amount of 400-600 IU. Here in this article, we will discuss some of the foods rich in calcium and vitamin D.

Revised:
Bones play a crucial role in our overall health and well-being, and there are two key nutrients that help to keep them strong: vitamin D and calcium. Vitamin D aids in the absorption of calcium, which is necessary for bone growth and development, while calcium gives our teeth and bones their structure.
While these nutrients are especially important for growing individuals, their importance does not diminish with age. In fact, getting enough vitamin D and calcium can help prevent diseases such as osteoporosis and reduce the risk of bone fractures as we age.
According to dietary recommendations, adults under the age of 50 should consume 1,000 mg of calcium and 200 IU of vitamin D each day, while those over the age of 50 should aim for 1,200 mg of calcium and 400-600 IU of vitamin D. In this article, we will explore some dietary sources of calcium and vitamin D.
